page.title: 03BEAR FLAT continued
page.content:
Even though this area is very built up there are still a variety of trees.The most common of these trees is the Horse Chestnut. Also in the Bear Flat area there are a couple of churches. They are called:St.Lukes and Shakespeare Methodist church. Opposite St.Lukes church there is a pub called the Devonshire Arms.In sight of this pub is the new Entry Hill golf course.
Edited by Paul North,Jason Humphries, Matthew Cardy,Andrew Wetherill. Typed by Nick Newport. Additional help from Cameron Sweet and Tim Back.
